content: When and how do I get a reply
creator: ferguson_1950

content:
Lets look at this.

I have no idea what " At present I cannot receive emails as previously" means to you. I am not aware of what was your defaults previously or what they are now! Are you asking for guesses? My guess is you don't like threading and want to turn it off. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird#w_disable-threading-on-a-folder

As for your mobile device, ask Telstra perhaps as I would guess they supply it. There is no Thunderbird app for Mobiles so it is outside the purview of this website.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: May I ask whether Thunderbird has recently been upgraded " I now cannot send or receive emails and am wondering whether it is Thunderbird or Telstra at fault
creator: ferguson_1950

content: To change default, try this: - click 'account settings' - highlight the account on left side that you want to make the default. - now, click the 'account actions' menu that lies below the list of accounts and select to make default. - use the same sequence of steps for any accounts you want to delete.
creator: davidsk

content:
First, uninstalling and reinstalling is NEVER a solution unless Thunderbird itself is not functioning or menus aren't working or screens are frozen repeatedly. Second, thunderbird is designed such that reinstalling need not affect the accounts. That is, before doing anything major, you should always 1) exit thunderbird and then, 2) copy the profile elsewhere. Also, the final prompt on an uninstall is whether to delete account data. So, even if you did a reinstall, the accounts will still be there and not lost. But it's not needed. I just added that as extra info.

On your problem, it is often helpful to delete the account if it's cause setup problems. The DONE you mention just means that Thunderbird found the servers. Your individual account remains unconfirmed. I always propose omitting password during setup and waiting for the prompt for it. Posting screenshots of your incoming and outgoing settings often prove useful, so those with Yahoo experience can comment on the settings.
creator: davidsk
